alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Greene; Hamblen; Jefferson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 11:12PM CDT until August 15 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Cocke County in east Tennessee... West Central Greene County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Hamblen County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Jefferson County in east Tennessee... * Until 415 AM EDT. * At 1212 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Law enforcement reports several roads in the White Pine area are impassable. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Morristown, White Pine, Baneberry, Mosheim, Lowland, Bybee and Mohawk. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
